intro: Maytenus mayana, commonly known as the Maya tree or sacred tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It is often found in lowland tropical forests and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine. Maytenus mayana is also culturally significant to indigenous communities in the region.
